questions.text: Choose the correct option:

parts.statement: Identify the indirect object in the sentence: "The band played music for the audience."
parts.explanation: The indirect object tells for whom or to whom the action is done. Here, the music is played for the audience.

parts.statement: Which shortcut key is used to save a document?
parts.explanation: Ctrl + S is the standard shortcut used to save files in most software applications.

parts.statement: Which command brings an object to the top layer?
parts.explanation: Bring to front places the selected object above all other objects.

parts.statement: Which of the following is NOT a means of communication?
parts.explanation: Public communication is a context, not a communication method like verbal or written.

parts.statement: How many Fundamental Duties are there in the Indian Constitution?
parts.explanation: The Indian Constitution prescribes eight Fundamental Duties for citizens.

questions.text: Fill in the blanks with correct option:

parts.statement: Keep your computer monitor at a distance of at least _____ inches.
parts.explanation: A distance of 20–30 inches helps reduce eye strain and maintains proper posture.

parts.statement: MS Access is an example of a _____.
parts.explanation: MS Access is a Database Management System used to store and manage data.

parts.statement: To turn off a computer click on the _____ option.
parts.explanation: Shutdown safely closes all programs and turns off the computer.

parts.statement: The file extension of LibreOffice Writer is _____.
parts.explanation: .odt stands for Open Document Text used by LibreOffice Writer.
Macro names must begin with a letter as per programming rules.

questions.text: Match Column A with Column B:
questions.explanation: Each item from Column A is correctly related to its function or category in Column B.

questions.text: Write True or False:

parts.statement: F5 is used to run a slide show.
parts.explanation: F5 starts the slide show from the beginning.

parts.statement: Employer and employee are responsible for workplace safety.
parts.explanation: Both employer and employee share responsibility for safety.

parts.statement: Once a TOC is created, it cannot be edited.
parts.explanation: A TOC can be updated or modified anytime.

parts.statement: Every macro should have a unique name.
parts.explanation: Unique names avoid conflicts between macros.
Spreadsheets can be shared online or offline.

questions.text: What is Track Change?
questions.explanation: Track Change is a feature in word processors that records edits such as insertions, deletions, and formatting changes made to a document.

questions.text: What is Form and Report?
questions.explanation: Form is used to enter and view data easily, while Report is used to present data in a formatted and printable manner.

questions.text: What is Time Management?
questions.explanation: Time management is the ability to plan and control how time is spent to improve efficiency and productivity.

questions.text: How can we contribute towards sustainable development?
questions.explanation: By conserving resources, reducing pollution, recycling waste, and promoting renewable energy.

questions.text: Write the steps to group more than one drawing object.
questions.explanation: Select objects → Right-click → Choose Group option to combine them.

questions.text: What is TOC (Table of Contents) in LibreOffice Writer?
questions.explanation: TOC is an organized list of headings in a document that helps users navigate content easily. It can be updated automatically.

questions.text: What is Multiple Operation? Explain with example.
questions.explanation: Multiple operation allows performing calculations on multiple values at once, such as calculating interest for different rates.

questions.text:
Explain the following:
(a) Data
(b) Information
questions.explanation: Data is raw facts, while information is processed data that has meaning.

questions.text: What is Verbal Communication? How many types of verbal communication are there?
questions.explanation: Verbal communication uses spoken or written words. It has two types: oral and written communication.

questions.text: What is Entrepreneurship? Explain in your own words.
questions.explanation: Entrepreneurship is the process of starting and managing a business by taking risks to earn profit.

questions.text: What is Computer Hardware and Software?
questions.explanation: Hardware is the physical components of a computer, while software is the set of programs that run on it.

questions.text: What is Hyperlink? How to edit hyperlink in Calc?
questions.explanation: A hyperlink connects one document or webpage to another. In Calc, right-click the link → Edit Hyperlink → modify details.

questions.text: What is Template? Write the steps to import a template.
questions.explanation: Template is a predefined document format. Import steps: File → Templates → Manage → Import.

questions.text: How many types of fire are there? Explain.
questions.explanation: There are mainly four types of fire: Class A, B, C, and D, based on materials involved.

questions.text: How does a many-to-many relationship work? Explain with example.
questions.explanation: In many-to-many relationship, multiple records relate to multiple records, such as students and courses.

questions.text: How to create a table using a wizard?
questions.explanation: Use Table Wizard → Select fields → Set primary key → Save table.
